title: So Force Pulse
body: Whats the point in the charge system built into the force pulse of {{champion:38}} .You dont gain any benefits from the charges aside from simply being able to cast the ability.

replies.body:
It's mainly a way of giving Kass increased access to his E in busy team fights versus in solo situations.

As a secondary benefit it also has some soft impact on which enemies Kass is a good choice against, though overall other factors are more important in determining which lanes are good/bad match ups for him.

But that doesn't matter because it already has a standard cooldown anyway.
You could have it do something different that makes more use out of the same idea, like an extremely low cooldown version (1 or 2 seconds) to give Kassadin some insane teamfight AoE
Or have spell casts not be required to cast it, but instead simply reduce the cooldown, (then increase the cooldown to compensate of course)
One of those would make it so Force Pulse feels like Kassadin benefits from the stack mechanic, rather than it being a power gate.

Yeah, it's a power gate. We could make a number of changes that would make it feel better, be more effective when used well. The issue there is that we don't have room to buff Kassadin. His core thing is his repeated blink, that has to sap a lot of power from the rest of his kit in compensation.

yeah, I don't really play kassadin so I couldnt tell you if he actually needed buffs

though I do think if you are really clever about it you could change it in a way that is both power neutral and feels better for the kassadin player. You could make it _feel_ like its a benefit to the player, while still being effectively a power gate

Kass is probably slightly closer to needing nerfs than buffs at present. Historically he's been a really hard champ to get into a somewhat balanced position though, so this is actually quite a good spot for him. That means both that we're cautious about making unnecessary changes to him and that there are other champs that need the work more. Changes that gate power as needed, and feel good to the player are possible, though often challenging designs. Adding a hard to balance champion to that mix increases the difficulty further. Still potentially doable, but at risk of being a lot of time that could be much better spent elsewhere is all.

It actually sort of does. During laning phase, I can't throw out E willy-nilly to clear waves or punish an enemy with Q+E when they wander in range, because my E is gated behind two requirements rather than just one (CD). It takes a little power from Kassadin, which makes his laning phase a little weaker without affecting his teamfighting. 

For example, Kassadin vs Azir means you'll have E up a *LOT*, while you'll get to use it less against Varus. 

Side-note: Kassadin's E also functions as a sort of radar. If you stand close enough, you can actually detect the jungler being near Raptors by way of checking your E counter go up despite no abilities being used in lane. It's also a good warning for Shaco. :D
